info.description:
The Model Management System (MMS) delivers AI models and other files needed by edge services to the edge nodes where those services are running. MMS has two components, and therefore two APIs: Cloud Sync Service (CSS) is the MMS component that runs on the management hub that users or devops processes use to load models/files into MMS. The Edge Sync Service (ESS) runs on each edge node and is the API that edge services interact with to get the models/files and find out about updates.

The Agent Secrets APIs enables service containers to receive updated secrets
info.title: Model Management System and Agent Secrets API

get.description:
Provides a list of destinations for an organization, i.e., ESS nodes (belonging to orgID) that have registered with the CSS.
This is a CSS only API.
get.summary: List all known destinations.

parameters.description: The orgID of the destinations to return.
parameters.name: orgID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the destinations

get.description:
Provides a list of objects that are in use by the destination ESS node.
This is a CSS only API.
get.summary: List all objects that are in use by the destination.

parameters.description: The orgID of the destination to retrieve objects for.
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The destType of the destination to retrieve objects for.
parameters.name: destType

parameters.description: The destID of the destination to retrieve objects for.
parameters.name: destID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the objects

get.description: Get health status of the sync service node.
get.summary: Get health status of the sync service node.

parameters.description: Whether or not to include the detailed health status
parameters.name: details

500.description: Failed to send health status.

get.description:
Get objects of the specified object type. Either get all of the objects or just those objects that have pending (unconsumed) updates.
An application would typically invoke the latter API periodically to check for updates (an alternative is to use a webhook).
get.summary: Get objects of the specified type.

parameters.description: The object type of the objects to return
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: When returning updated objects only, whether or not to include the objects that have been marked as received by the application
parameters.name: received

500.description: Failed to retrieve the updated objects

put.description:
Register or delete a webhook for the specified object type.
A webhook is used to process notifications on updates for objects of the specified object type.

parameters.description: The object type of the objects for the webhook
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The webhook's data
parameters.name: payload

500.description: Failed to update the webhook's data

get.description:
Get the metadata of an object of the specified object type and object ID.
The metadata indicates if the objects includes data which can then be obtained using the appropriate API.
get.summary: Get an object.

parameters.description: The object type of the object to return
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to return
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the object

put.description:
Update/create the object of the specified object type and object ID.
If an object with the same type and ID exists that object is updated, otherwise a new object is created.

parameters.description: The object type of the object to update/create
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to update/create
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to update/create the object

delete.description:
Delete the object of the specified object type and object ID.
Destinations of the object will be notified that the object has been deleted.

parameters.description: The object type of the object to delete
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to delete
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to delete the object

put.description:
Mark the object of the specified object type and object ID as active.
An object can be created as inactive which means it is not delivered to its destinations.
This API is used to activate such objects and initiate the distribution of the object to its destinations.

parameters.description: The object type of the object to mark as active
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to mark as active
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to mark the object active

put.description:
Mark the object of the specified object type and object ID as having been consumed by the application.
After the object is marked as consumed it will not be delivered to the application again (even if the sync service is restarted).

parameters.description: The object type of the object to mark as consumed
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to mark as consumed
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to mark the object consumed

get.description:
Get the data of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
The metadata of the object indicates if the object includes data (noData is false).
get.summary: Get the data of an object.

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose data will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose data will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the object's data

put.description:
Update the data of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
The data can be updated without modifying the object's metadata.
put.summary: Update the data of an object.

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose data will be updated
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose data will be updated
parameters.name: objectID

parameters.description: The object's new data. When read data bytes from a file, please set application/octet-stream as Content-Type in header.
parameters.name: payload

500.description: Failed to update the object's data

put.description:
Mark the object of the specified object type and object ID as having been received by the application.
After the object is marked as received it will only be delivered to the application again if specified in the objects request.

parameters.description: The object type of the object to mark as received
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object to mark as received
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to mark the object received

get.description:
Get the status of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
The status can be one of the following:
notReady - The object is not ready to be sent to destinations.
ready - The object is ready to be sent to destinations.
received - The object's metadata has been received but not all its data.
completelyReceived - The full object (metadata and data) has been received.
consumed - The object has been consumed by the application.
deleted - The object was deleted.
get.summary: Get the status of an object.

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose status will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose status will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the object's status

get.description: Get all objects of the specified object type that have a destination policy.
get.summary: Get objects with a destination policy of the specified type.

parameters.description: The object type of the objects to return
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: Whether or not to include all objects. If false only updated objects will be returned.
parameters.name: all_objects

200.description: Objects with a destination policy response

404.description: No objects with a destination policy found

500.description: Failed to retrieve the updated objects

Confirm the deletion of the object of the specified object type and object ID by the application.
The application should invoke this API after it completed the actions associated with deleting the object.

get.description:
Get the list of sync service (ESS) nodes which are the destinations of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
The delivery status of the object is provided for each destination along with its type and ID.
This is a CSS only API.
get.summary: Get the destinations of an object.

parameters.description: The orgID of the object whose destinations will be retrieved. Present only when working with a CSS, removed from the path when working with an ESS
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose destinations will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose destinations will be retrieved
parameters.name: objectID

500.description: Failed to retrieve the object's destinations

put.description:
Set the list of sync service (ESS) nodes to be the destinations of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
This is a CSS only API.
put.summary: Set the destinations of an object.

parameters.description: The orgID of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: objectID

parameters.description: The object's destination list
parameters.name: payload

500.description: Failed to update the object's destinations

post.description:
Add or delete the list of sync service (ESS) nodes to/from be the destinations of the object of the specified object type and object ID.
This is a CSS only API.
post.summary: Add/Delete the destinations of an object.

parameters.description: The orgID of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The object type of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: objectType

parameters.description: The object ID of the object whose destinations will be updated
parameters.name: objectID

parameters.description: The object's destination list to add or remove
parameters.name: payload

500.description: Failed to update the object's destinations

Get the list of objects that have destination policies.
An application would typically invoke this API periodically to check for updates.

parameters.description: Objects that have a Destination Policy which was updated since the specified UTC time in nanoseconds should be fetched.
parameters.name: since

Get the list of objects that satisfy the given filters

parameters.description: The property name defined inside destination policy to which objects have affinity, whose Destination Policy should be fetched.
parameters.name: dpPropertyName

parameters.description: Objects that have a Destination Policy which was updated since the specified timestamp in RFC3339 should be fetched.
parameters.name: since

parameters.name: destinationID

parameters.description: Fetch the objects with noData marked to true
parameters.name: noData

parameters.description: Fetch the objects with expiration time before specified timestamp in RFC3339 format
parameters.name: expirationTimeBefore

500.description: Failed to retrieve the objects

Get the list of objects that have destination policies.
An application would typically invoke this API periodically to check for updates.

parameters.description: Must be true to indicate that objects with destinationPolicy are to be retrieved
parameters.name: destination_policy

parameters.name: received

parameters.description: The ID of the service (orgID/serviceName) to which objects have affinity, whose Destination Policy should be fetched.

parameters.description: Objects that have a Destination Policy which was updated since the specified UTC time in nanoseconds should be fetched.

get.description: Get the list of existing organizations. Relevant to CSS only.

parameters.description: The orgID of the organization to update.
parameters.name: orgID

500.description: Failed to update the organization

delete.description:
Remove organization information and clean up all resources (objects, destinations, etc.) all resources (objects, destinations, etc.) associated
with the deleted organization. Relevant to CSS only.

parameters.description: The orgID of the organization to delete.
parameters.name: orgID

500.description: Failed to delete the organization

post.description:
Used by an ESS to ask the CSS to resend it all the objects (supported only for ESS to CSS requests).
An application only needs to use this API in case the data it previously obtained from the ESS was lost.

400.description: The request is not allowed on Cloud Sync-Service

get.description: Get the list of updated secrets.
get.summary: Get secrets.

500.description: Failed to retrieve the secret names of updated secrets

parameters.description: The secret name of the secret object to return
parameters.name: secretName

500.description: Failed to retrieve the secret

Mark the secret as having been received by the service.
After the secret is marked as received, it will no longer be returned by GET /secrets again.

parameters.description: The secret name of the secret to mark as received
parameters.name: secretName

500.description: Failed to mark the object consumed

get.summary: Retrieve the list of destination type or object type of ACLs for an organization.

parameters.description: The type of the ACL whose username list should be retrieved.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The orgID in which the ACL for the destination type or object type exists.
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: If true, display object/destination types that has ACL list associated with
parameters.name: all_keys

parameters.description: The destination type or object type that is being protected by the ACL.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The acl user type (user or node) to retrieve.
parameters.name: acl_usertype

put.description:
Bulk add/remove of user(s) to/from an ACL for all destination types or all object types. If the
first username is being added, the ACL is created. If the last username is removed, the ACL
is deleted.
put.summary: Bulk add/remove of user(s) to/from an ACL for all destination types or all object types.

parameters.description: The type of the ACL to which the specified username(s) will be added/removed.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The orgID in which the ACL for the destination type or object type exists.
parameters.name: orgID

204.description: The username(s) were added/removed to/from the specified ACL.

500.description: Failed to add/remove the username(s) to/from the specified ACL.

put.description:
Bulk add/remove of username(s) to/from an ACL for a destination type or an object type. If the
first username is being added, the ACL is created. If the last username is removed, the ACL
is deleted.
put.summary: Bulk add/remove of username(s) to/from an ACL for a destination type or an object type.

parameters.description: The type of the ACL to which the specified user(s) will be added/removed.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The orgID in which the ACL for the destination type or object type exists.
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The destination type or object type that is being protected by the ACL.
parameters.name: key

204.description: The user(s) were added/removed to/from the specified ACL.

500.description: Failed to add/remove the user(s)to/from the specified ACL.

delete.description:
Remove a user from an ACL for a destination type or an object type. If the last username is removed,
the ACL is deleted as well.
delete.summary: Remove a user from an ACL for a destination type or an object type.

parameters.description: The type of the ACL to remove the specified username from.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The orgID in which the ACL for the destination type or object type exists.
parameters.name: orgID

parameters.description: The destination type or object type that is being protected by the ACL.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The acl user type of given username to be deleted
parameters.name: acl_usertype

parameters.description: The username to remove from the specified ACL.
parameters.name: username

204.description: The username was removed from the specified ACL.

500.description: Failed to remove the username from the specified ACL.

ACLentry.description: ACLentry contains ACL information about each user

IdentityToken.description: An opaque token used to authenticate a user after a successful login

BoundSecret.title: a binding that maps a secret name to a secret manager secret name.

ConstraintExpression.title: This type implements all the ConstraintLanguage Plugin methods and delegates to plugin system.

ContainerChangeResponseItem.description: ContainerChangeResponseItem change item in response to ContainerChanges operation

Path.description: Path to file that has changed

ContainerCreateCreatedBody.description: ContainerCreateCreatedBody OK response to ContainerCreate operation

Id.description: The ID of the created container

Warnings.description: Warnings encountered when creating the container

ContainerTopOKBody.description: ContainerTopOKBody OK response to ContainerTop operation

Processes.description:
Each process running in the container, where each is process
is an array of values corresponding to the titles.

ContainerUpdateOKBody.description: ContainerUpdateOKBody OK response to ContainerUpdate operation

ContainerWaitOKBody.description: ContainerWaitOKBody OK response to ContainerWait operation

ContainerWaitOKBodyError.description: ContainerWaitOKBodyError container waiting error, if any

DBHealthStatusInfo.description: DBHealthStatusInfo describes the health status of the database of the sync-service node

Destination.description:
Each sync service edge node (ESS) has an address that is composed of the node's ID, Type, and Organization.
An ESS node communicates with the CSS using either MQTT or HTTP.
Destination.title: Destination describes a sync service node.

codeVersion.description: CodeVersion is the sync service code version used by the destination

communication.description: Communication is the communication protocol used by the destination to connect (can be MQTT or HTTP)

destinationOrgID.description:
DestOrgID is the destination organization ID
Each sync service object belongs to a single organization

DestinationsStatus.description:
DestinationsStatus describes the delivery status of an object for a destination
DestinationsStatus provides information about the delivery status of an object for a certain destination.
The status can be one of the following:
Indication whether the object has been delivered to the destination
pending - inidicates that the object is pending delivery to this destination
delivering - indicates that the object is being delivered to this destination
delivered - indicates that the object was delivered to this destination
consumed - indicates that the object was consumed by this destination
deleted - indicates that this destination acknowledged the deletion of the object
error - indicates that a feedback error message was received from this destination

message.description: Message is the message for the destination

HealthStatusInfo.description: HealthStatusInfo describes the health status of the sync-service node

MQTTHealthStatusInfo.description: MQTTHealthStatusInfo describes the health status of the MQTT connection of the sync-service node

MetaData.description:
Every object includes metadata (mandatory) and data (optional). The metadata and data can be updated independently.
Each sync service node (ESS) has an address that is composed of the node's ID, Type, and Organization.
To send an object to a single node set the destinationType and destinationID fields to match the node's Type and ID.
To send an object to all the nodes of a certain type set destinationType to the appropriate type and leave destinationID empty.
If both destinationType and destinationID are empty the object is sent to all nodes.
MetaData.title: MetaData is the metadata that identifies and defines the sync service object.

activationTime.description:
ActivationTime is a timestamp/date as to when this object should automatically be activated.
The timestamp should be provided in RFC3339 format.
Optional field, if omitted (and Inactive is true) the object is never automatically activated.

autodelete.description:
AutoDelete is a flag indicating whether to delete the object after it is delivered to all its destinations from the DestinationsList.
Optional field, default is false (do not delete).
This field is used only when working with the CSS. Objects are always deleted after delivery on the ESS.

chunkSize.description:
ChunkSize is an internal field indicating the maximal message payload size.
This field should not be set by users.

consumers.description:
ExpectedConsumers is the number of applications that are expected to indicate that they have consumed the object.
Optional field, default is 1.

dataID.description:
DataID is an internal data ID.
This field should not be set by users.

deleted.description:
Deleted is a flag indicating to applications polling for updates that this object has been deleted.
Read only field, should not be set by users.

description.description:
Description is a textual description of the object.
Optional field, empty by default.

destinationDataUri.description:
DestinationDataURI is a URI indicating where the receiver of the object should store it.
Currently only file URIs are supported.
This field is available only when working with the CSS.
Optional field, if omitted the object is stored in the node's internal storage.

destinationID.description:
DestID is the ID of the destination. If omitted the object is sent to all ESSs with the same DestType.
This field is ignored when working with ESS (the destination is the CSS).

destinationOrgID.description:
DestOrgID is the organization ID of the object (an object belongs to exactly one organization).
This field is ignored when working with ESS (the ESS's orgID is used).

destinationType.description:
DestType is the type of destination to send the object to.
If omitted (and if DestinationsList is omitted too) the object is broadcasted to all known destinations.
This field is ignored when working with ESS (the destination is always the CSS).

destinationsList.description:
DestinationsList is the list of destinations as type:id pairs to send the object to.
When a DestinationsList is provided DestType and DestID must be omitted.
This field is ignored when working with ESS (the destination is always the CSS).

expiration.description:
Expiration is a timestamp/date indicating when the object expires.
When the object expires it is automatically deleted.
The timestamp should be provided in RFC3339 format.
This field is available only when working with the CSS.
Optional field, if omitted the object doesn't expire.

hashAlgorithm.description:
HashAlgorithm used for data signature sign/verification. "SHA1" and "SHA256" are supported hash algorithms.
Valid values are: "SHA1", "SHA256"
Optional field, if omitted the data signature/verification will not be applied

inactive.description:
Inactive is a flag indicating that this object is inactive for now.
An object can be created as inactive which means it is not delivered to its destination. The object can be activated later.
Optional field, default is false (object active).

instanceID.description:
InstanceID is an internal instance ID.
This field should not be set by users.

link.description:
Link is a link to where the data for this object can be fetched from.
The link is set and used by the application. The sync service does not access the link.
Optional field, if omitted the data must be provided by the application.

metaOnly.description:
MetaOnly is a flag that indicates that this update is only of the metadata. The current object's data is left unchanged.
Optional field, default is false (both data and metadata are updated).

noData.description:
NoData is a flag indicating that there is no data for this object.
Objects with no data can be used, for example, to send notifications.
Optional field, default is false (object includes data).

objectID.description: ObjectID is a unique identifier of the object

objectSize.description:
ObjectSize is an internal field indicating the size of the object's data.
This field should not be set by users.

objectType.description:
ObjectType is the type of the object.
The type is used to group multiple objects, for example when checking for object updates.

originID.description:
OriginID is the ID of origin of the object. Set by the internal code.
Read only field, should not be set by users.

originType.description:
OriginType is the type of origin of the object. Set by the internal code.
Read only field, should not be set by users.

ownerID.description:
OwnerID is an internal field indicating who creates the object
This field should not be set by users

public.description:
Public is a flag indicate this object is visiable to all users in all orgs
Optional field, default is false (not visiable to all users)

publicKey.description:
PublicKey is a base64 encoded string. It is the publicKey to verify the data of the object
Optional field, if omitted the data will not be verified with public key and signature

signature.description:
Signature is a base64 encoded string. It is the data signature to verify data of the object
Optional field, if omitted the data will not be verified with public key and signature

sourceDataUri.description:
SourceDataURI is a URI indicating where the sender of the object should read the data from.
Currently only file URIs are supported.
This field is available only when working with the ESS.
Optional field, if omitted the object's data should be provided by the user.

version.description:
Version is the object's version (as used by the application).
Optional field, empty by default.

ObjectDestinationPolicy.title: ObjectDestinationPolicy contains information about an object that has a Destination Policy.

destinations.description: Destinations is the list of the object's current destinations

objectID.description: ObjectID is a unique identifier of the object

objectType.description:
ObjectType is the type of the object.
The type is used to group multiple objects, for example when checking for object updates.

orgID.description: OrgID is the organization ID of the object (an object belongs to exactly one organization).

ObjectStatus.description:
ObjectStatus describes the delivery status of an object for a destination
The status can be one of the following:
Indication whether the object has been delivered to the destination
delivering - indicates that the object is being delivered
delivered - indicates that the object was delivered
consumed - indicates that the object was consumed
deleted - indicates that this destination acknowledged the deletion of the object
error - indicates that a feedback error message was received

orgID.description: OrgID is the organization ID of the organization

status.description: Status is the object status for this destination

address.description: Address is the broker address to be used when connecting to this organization

orgID.description: OrgID is the organization ID of the organization

password.description: Password is the password to be used when connecting to this organization

user.description: User is the user name to be used when connecting to this organization

Policy.description: Policy describes a policy made up of a set of properties and constraints

constraints.description: Constraints is a set of expressions that form the constraints for the policy

properties.description: Properties is the set of properties for a particular policy

services.description: Services is the list of services this object has affinity for

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicates when the policy was last updated (result of time.Now().UTC().UnixNano())

PolicyProperty.description: PolicyProperty is a property in a policy

name.description: Name is the name of the property

type.description:
Type is the type of the property.
It is only required where the system can't interpret the value correctly by context.

value.description: Value is the value of the property

PropertyList.description: This struct represents property values advertised by the policy

SecretBinding.description: The secret binding that maps service secret names to secret manager secret names

ServiceID.description: ServiceID contains the ID of a service to which an object may have affinity for

arch.description: Arch is the architecture of the service

orgID.description: OrgID is the organization ID of the service

serviceName.description: ServiceName is the name of the service

version.description: Version is the version of the service

UsageInfo.description: UsageInfo describes the usage of the sync-service node

UserInput.title: UserInput This type is used to describe a configuration variable that the node owner/user has to set before the service is able to execute on the edge node.

bulkACLUpdate.description:
bulkACLUpdate is the payload used when performing a bulk update on an ACL (either adding uses to an
ACL or removing users from an ACL.

action.description: Action is an action, which can be either add (to add users) or remove (to remove users)

users.description: aclUsers is an array of ACL entries to be added or removed from the ACL as appropriate. Don's specify ACLRole if action is "remove"

bulkDestUpdate.description: bulkDestUpdate is the payload used when need to add or remove destinations for an object

destinations.description: Destinations is an array of destinations, each entry is an string in form of "<destinationType>:<destinationID>"

objectUpdate.description:
objectUpdate includes the object's metadata and data
A sync service object includes metadata and optionally binary data.
When an object is created the metadata must be provided. The metadata and the data can then be updated together or one at a time.

data.description: Data is a the object's binary data

organization.description: organization includes the organization's id and broker address

secretObject.title: secretObject includes the secret key and secret value.

webhookUpdate.description:
webhookUpdate includes the webhook's action and URL
A webhook can be used to allow the sync service to invoke actions when new information becomes available.
An application can choose between using a webhook and periodically polling the sync service for updates.

action.description: Action is an action can be either register (create/update a webhook) or delete (delete the webhook)

url.description: URL is the URL to invoke when new information for the object is available
